text: Keg at the brewery taproom - January 2016. Pours unclear gold with a foamy, white head. Nice and juicy citrus fruits in the nose, tangerine, orange rind. Light to medium sweet flavour, quite dry and pithy, with more orange, grapefruit, peach. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Dry finish, pithy and fresh, with more tangerine, grapefruit, mellow rindy bitterness. Excellent.

The beer is bright gold. Fairly clear. Solid white head. Lots of tropical flavor in the aroma. Pretty big citrus. Mango, papaya, pineapple, tangerine, lime. Light bitterness in the taste. Fairly dry. Not really juicy but nice hop flavor.
On tap at Cellarmaker. Pours golden with a clinging white head and a strong citrus aroma. There is a solid pale malt base supporting an excellent hop profile. Balanced with an earthy Mosaic finish.

Draft at Cellarmaker. Pours a hazy gold color with a small white head that laces the glass and settles into a ring. Another dank pale ale here, with citrus and tropical fruits, particularly the melons, herbs and spices, pale malts, and grass. Light-bodied, with medium carbonation, and simultaneously dank and dry on the mouthfeel. Fun, fresh, nice. I have no idea what HBC 344 is but this one really pops. Fantastic APA.

On tap @ Cellarmaker. Hazed golden straw beer with a thin white head. Holy crap is this juicy. So much lime, grapefruit, and lemon. Very tropical, too. Big watermelon, gooseberry, and cantaloupe. Solid, but mild, bitterness. Light malt flavor and sweetness as well. Big tropical and fruity pebble flavor to go with all the citrus fruits. Intensely zesty. Damn good.
[1/27/16] Draught at Cellarmaker in San Francisco. Cloudy yellow. Aroma of citric, oniony, slightly tropical hops. Flavor of fruity and mildly oniony hops. Medium-bodied. Refreshing.

Keg at Cellarmaker, 28/01/16. 
Lightly hazed golden orange with a decent off white head.
Nose is dank hops, pine, pissy citric peel, orange pith, light grapefruit.
Taste comprises a big dank hop smack, pine resin, tangerine, grapefruit encore.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close doused in dank hop bitterness.
Solid APA.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Draft - Citrus and mango.  Cloudy gold with a nice white head.  Bitter and orange peel with tons of pith and a long bitter finish.
On tap at the brewery. Pours a cloudy yellow with small white head that lasts. The aroma is pineaplle, dank. Medium mouth, tropical fruit, dry bitterness, light juicy. Very nice.

On draft at Cellarmaker. It pours a lightly hazed yellow color with a white head. The aroma has that typical Cellarmaker potent blast of fresh citrus and tropical fruit. A little bit of hop spice. The flavor is full with grapefruit and pineapple. Crackery malt as the base. A little spicy bitterness. Crackery and bready with a lightly creamy mouthfeel that sends this one over the top for me. Very tasty.

On tap at cellarmaker San Francisco. pours out a cloudy pale straw color topped with a white head. nose is great nice hop citrus and floral along with a nice malty sweetness. taste is more of the citrus hops dank and a nice sweetness.

On tap at Cellarmaker. Hazy gold pour with lacy white head. Super super dank citra mosaic aroma, light biscuity malt, super juicy, fruity and dank. Taste is lightly bitter, so juicy and hoppy. Palate is light-med bodied, with light-med carbonation. Excellent.

Growler shipped across the country in a couple of days -- thanks a ton, misterburd. This is one cool beer. Despite the name, its as heavy on the dank hops as the citra fruity ones. It smells absolutely fantastic (like earth and fruit), but I found the taste to be a bit soapy from the Mosaic. Still, thats personal taste, and theres no denying that this is one insanely good beer.

Draught at Cellarmaker. Light hazy light golden liquid with medium off-white head. Aroma of citrus, mango, tangerine, light grain, lychee, fresh hops, weed and sweet fruit. Taste is dry and light to medium bitter with notes of citrus, mango, tangerine, light grain and lychee. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Awesome. Super sessionable, very aromatic. Fantastic.

Draft. Source. Holy fucken amazing citra hop nose. Just makes wet smelling it. Hazy pale orange with minimal head. Taste is a tad grassy but still mostly tropical fruit. A touch thin and light in CO2. Nails the aroma but I want just a bit more in the taste and mouthfeel.
What ehy do best - light refreshing beer showcasing my two favorite hops. Juicy explosion of tropical fruit and citrus, I could drink this all day.

On tap at Cellarmaker. Hazed bright yellow coloured pour with a fine white head. Aroma is nice big dank and juicy hop, citrus , a little smoked hop. Flavour is composed of nice dank citrus hop, orange rind, light burnt lemon, nice clean base grains. Palate is nice medium bodied, little resin, highish carbonation. Very good.
